Lyrics: You put your right hand out
Spread the ear pollution both far and wide
Keep your contributions by your side and stroke me, stroke me
Could be a winner, boy, you move quite well
Say you're a winner but man you're just a sinner now
You put your left foot out
First you try to bed me
But when you find you bled me
Give me the business all night long
Say you're a winner but man you're just a sinner now
Say you're a winner but man you're just a sinner now
Comments: Like The Violent Femmes‘ Blister in the Sun, Billy Idol’s Dancing with Myself, and The Vapors’ Turning Japanese, this song’s artist stridently denies that it’s about masturbation.
According to Squire, it’s about the ego stroking that goes on in the music industry.
At the very least, each line is a clever double-entendre that can indeed be taken that way.
Since Squire was already a 12 year veteran recording artist when this song became his first hit, it’s entirely reasonable that he was taking aim at the industry.
Title: Billy Squier – The Stroke Lyrics | Genius Lyrics
